thread.title: Malaysian Police Seize $28 Million in Cash as Part of 1MDB Probe

author: Yantoultra Ngui
title: Malaysian Police Seize $28 Million in Cash as Part of 1MDB Probe
text:
KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysiaâ€”Malaysian police said they seized the equivalent of more than $28 million in 26 different currencies in an empty apartment searched as part of an investigation into 1Malaysia Development Bhd., the troubled state investment fund founded by former Prime Minister Najib Razak.
Commercial-crime division chief Amar Singh said Friday that police searched several properties in an operation that began May 18, including apartments belonging to a son and a daughter of Mr. Najib, in addition to his personal residence.... RELATED VIDEO How the 1MDB Scandal Spread Across the World Starting in Malaysia, a scandal involving the 1MDB fund set up by Prime Minister Najib Razak now involves at least 10 countries, including the U.S. This animation shows how money allegedly misappropriated from 1MDB moved through global wealth centers before being used to buy real estate, art, and other assets around the world, including in New York and Beverley Hills. Illustration: Oliver Osborne for The Wall Street Journal. (Originally published Jan. 12, 2017)
